hypotheses.null_hypothesis: There is no significant relationship between job satisfaction and employee attrition.
hypotheses.alternative_hypothesis: Employees with lower job satisfaction are more likely to leave the organization.
hypotheses.rationale: Exploring the relationship between job satisfaction (numerical) and employee attrition (categorical) can reveal if dissatisfied employees are more likely to leave.

hypotheses.null_hypothesis: There is no significant correlation between years at company and employee attrition.
hypotheses.alternative_hypothesis: Employees who have been with the company for a shorter period are more likely to leave.
hypotheses.rationale: Investigating the correlation between years spent at the company (numerical) and employee attrition (categorical) may uncover if tenure impacts turnover.

hypotheses.null_hypothesis: There is no significant relationship between overtime work rate and employee attrition.
hypotheses.alternative_hypothesis: Employees working more overtime are more likely to leave the organization.
hypotheses.rationale: Examining the relationship between overtime work rate (categorical) and employee attrition (categorical) can determine if excessive overtime contributes to higher turnover.
